wiki.summary: First album by Kyrgyz black metal band Darkestrah, released on January 1, 2004. It is a concept album about three sisters of nature, based on a legend from Kyrgyz mythology. It features substantial influence from Kyrgyz folk music, giving it a unique flavour in black metal, as well as influence from genres like post-rock and progressive metal. Last.fm's track listing is completely incorrect, as it combines the first two songs into one track and truncates all three titles. The correct track listing is: Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: First album by Kyrgyz black metal band Darkestrah, released on January 1, 2004. It is a concept album about three sisters of nature, based on a legend from Kyrgyz mythology. It features substantial influence from Kyrgyz folk music, giving it a unique flavour in black metal, as well as influence from genres like post-rock and progressive metal. Last.fm's track listing is completely incorrect, as it combines the first two songs into one track and truncates all three titles. The correct track listing is: 1. Part I - Sary Oy - 11:10 2. Part II - Jashil Oy - 10:48 3. Part III - Kyzil Oy - 25:28 Or, alternatively: 1. Sary Oy - 11:10 2. Jashil Oy - 10:48 3. Kyzil Oy - 25:28 Note that some sources spell the third track's title as Kysil Oy. It is possible that some releases of the album have used this alternate spelling, but the back of the CD box spells it as Kyzil Oy (seen here). Read more on Last.fm.
